title: Sen.Merritt Press Conference on GLBC Priorities | 02/02/2026
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia Legislative Black Caucus press conference on their 2026 legislative priorities:

## Overview
The Georgia Legislative Black Caucus (GLBC) held a press conference to unveil their 2026 legislative priorities, which were shaped directly by the voices, needs, and lived experiences of the communities they serve. The priorities focus on key areas like economic justice, healthcare access, housing, voting rights, education, and criminal justice reform.

## Key Actions
None detected.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
None detected.

## Notable Moments
- The GLBC chair emphasized the caucus' commitment to advancing justice, equity, and opportunity for all Georgians.
- Rep. Jasmine Clark discussed the importance of the Georgia Civil Rights Act of 2026 (HB 670/SB 320), which aims to strengthen civil rights protections in the state.
- Christopher Bruce of the ACLU of Georgia spoke passionately about the need to defend civil rights and liberties in Georgia.

## Votes
No recorded votes.

## Attendance
No specific quorum notes.

## Adjournment
The press conference concluded, but no specific adjournment time or next session date was provided.
